page.title: 09RAIL TRANSPORT
page.content: A section of the main Inter-City route between Shrewsbury and Wolverhampton runs through the area studied.It runs parallel to the A464(T).The line is double track and provides a regular passenger service between Shrewsbury (and through to Mid Wales)and the link at Wolverhampton with the Inter-City trains to Euston. There is one station in the area and that is at Cosford.This was opened as a halt not long after the R.A.F.camp was opened to provide a service for servicemen travelling by train.Today local stopping trains call at the station every 2 hours whilst Inter-City trains pass straight through.Over 85% of the passengers using the station today are servicemen 10% are pupils attending schools and colleges in Telford or Wolverhampton. Frieght trains also use the line.
